intro: Salacia bipindensis var. obovata, commonly known as the obovate salacia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, obovate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
